post.description: Request an activation token for verifying an email or activating an account
Redeem an activation token to verify an email or activate an account

delete.description: Delete asset from catalogue. Required roles: ROLE_PROVIDER

get.description: Gets metadata property value for the specified resource file. Roles required: ROLE_USER

delete.description: Remove all items from the cart

get.description: Get shopping cart for the current user session

post.description: Search catalogue published items based on one or more criteria. Supports data paging and sorting.

get.description: Get a single catalogue item by its unique identifier.
Get application configuration with optional localized resources

delete.description: Cancel any pending consumer registration request. Roles required: ROLE_USER

post.description: Create or update consumer draft data in the profile of the authenticated user. When saving draft data, validation errors are ignored. Roles required: ROLE_USER

put.description: Update consumer data in the profile of the authenticated user. Roles required: ROLE_USER

delete.description: Deletes a file or directory. A directory must be empty before deletion. Roles required: ROLE_USER

parameters.description: Relative path in user's remote file system
parameters.name: path

get.description: List (recursively) files and folders for user's directory. Roles required: ROLE_USER

parameters.description: File path in user's remote file system
parameters.name: path

post.description: Uploads a file to the user's remote file system. If the path does not exist, it is created. If the file already exists, the overwrite attribute must be set to true, or an error is returned. Roles required: ROLE_USER
Creates a directory in the user's remote file system by creating all nonexistent parent directories first. Roles required: ROLE_USER
Sends a message to Helpdesk from the authenticated user
Sends a message to the specified provider from the authenticated user
post.summary: Send a message to a provider

post.description: Sends a message to the specified user from a Helpdesk account
post.summary: Send a message to a platform user

post.description: Reply to a message accessible to the authenticated user

get.description: Get profile data for the authenticated user. Roles required: ROLE_USER

post.description: Update the profile of the authenticated user. Roles required: ROLE_USER

get.description: Search catalogue for provider's draft items based on one or more criteria. Supports data paging and sorting. Required roles: ROLE_PROVIDER

delete.description: Delete a draft item. Required roles: ROLE_PROVIDER

get.description: Get a single catalogue draft item by its unique identifier. Required roles: ROLE_PROVIDER

put.description: Update an existing draft item. Resources that are not included in the request, are automatically deleted. Required roles: ROLE_PROVIDER

post.description: Uploads an additional resource file and links it to selected draft instance. On success, an updated draft is returned with the new resource registration.Roles required: ROLE_PROVIDER

get.description: Downloads an additional resource file. Roles required: ROLE_PROVIDER

post.description: Uploads a resource file and links it to selected draft instance. On success, an updated draft is returned with the new resource registration.Roles required: ROLE_PROVIDER

get.description: Gets metadata property value for the specified resource file. Roles required: ROLE_PROVIDER

put.description: Accept or reject draft by a provider. The draft status must be PENDING_PROVIDER_REVIEW. Required roles: ROLE_PROVIDER
Update draft and submit for review and publication. Required roles: ROLE_PROVIDER

delete.description: Cancel any pending provider registration request. Required roles: ROLE_USER

post.description: Save a provider registration request as a draft. When saving draft data, validation errors are ignored. Required roles: ROLE_USER

put.description: Submit a provider registration request to the OP platform. Required roles: ROLE_USER

get.description: Get all ratings for a specific asset

post.description: Adds a new rating for a specific asset. Required roles: ROLE_CONSUMER

get.description: Get all ratings for a specific provider

post.description: Adds a new rating for a specific provider. Required roles: ROLE_CONSUMER

get.description: Get a list of recommended assets for the currently authenticated user.

parameters.description: Maximum number of recommended assets to return
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Default redirect endpoint for successful forms login operations, used for refreshing the CSRF token
Default redirect endpoint for successful logout operations, used for refreshing the CSRF token

verifyPassword.description: Account password verification. Must match property password.

activatedAt.description: Date of account activation. Activation occurs when the user email is verified

emailVerified.description: True if the email address is verified

idpUserImage.description: User image URL as retrieved by the IDP user info endpoint

idpUserName.description: User name as retrieved by the IDP user info endpoint

roles.description: User roles. Every user has at least role ROLE_USER.

username.description: User name (always equal to user email)

success.description: True if operation was successful; Otherwise False.

ActivationTokenCommandDto.description: A command used to verify an account or profile email

assetDraft.description: Catalogue draft id. Always equal to key property

assetPublished.description: Published asset id. The value is generated by the PID service

helpdeskRejectionReason.description: Rejection reason if the draft has been rejected by a HelpDesk user

ingested.description: True if the file should be imported into PostGIS database and published using WMS/WFS endpoints

key.description: Draft unique identifier. Also the key for the catalogue draft record. If the draft is submitted and a workflow instance is initialized, it is used as the business key

modifiedOn.description: Date of lat update in ISO format

providerRejectionReason.description: Rejection reason if the draft has been rejected by the provider

fileName.description: File name. If not set, the name of uploaded file is used.

description.description: The description of the file. If not set, the file name is used as text

bundleExtensions.description: Supported file extensions included in a bundle

items.description: Supported file extensions included in a bundle

bundleSupported.description: True if multiple files are supported

fileName.description: File name. If not set, the name of uploaded file is used.

success.description: True if operation was successful; Otherwise False.

text.description: The text displayed for the URI. If not set, the uri value is used as text

success.description: True if operation was successful; Otherwise False.

totalItems.description: Number of items in the cart

success.description: True if operation was successful; Otherwise False.

additionalResources.description: Auxiliary files or additional resources to the dataset

conformity.description: Degree of conformity with the implementing rules/standard of the metadata followed

creationDate.description: A point or period of time associated with the creation event in the lifecycle of the resource

dateEnd.description: The temporal extent of the resource (end date)

dateStart.description: The temporal extent of the resource (start date)

format.description: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource

ingested.description: True if the resource files should be imported into PostGIS database and published using WMS/WFS endpoints. Ingest operation is only supported for formats of category VECTOR

externalDocs.description: See configuration endpoint for asset file types details

language.description: A language of the resource as an ISO 639-1 two-letter code

lineage.description: General explanation of the data producer's knowledge about the lineage of a dataset

metadataDate.description: The date which specifies when the metadata record was created or updated

metadataLanguage.description: The language in which the metadata elements are expressed as a ISO 639-1 two-letter code

metadataPointOfContactEmail.description: The email of the organization responsible for the creation and maintenance of the metadata

metadataPointOfContactName.description: The name of the organization responsible for the creation and maintenance of the metadata

parentId.description: Provides the ID of a parent dataset

publicAccessLimitations.description: Information on the limitations and the reasons for them

publicationDate.description: A point or period of time associated with the publication even in the lifecycle of the resource

publisherEmail.description: Email of an entity responsible for making the resource available

publisherName.description: Name of an entity responsible for making the resource available

resourceLocator.description: The 'navigation section' of a metadata record which point users to the location (URL) where the data can be downloaded, or to where additional information about the resource may be provided

resources.description: Provides a list of resources of the dataset

revisionDate.description: A point or period of time associated with the revision event in the lifecycle of the resource

scales.description: Scale refers to the level of detail of the data set

spatialDataServiceType.description: The nature or genre of the service

spatialResolution.description: Spatial resolution refers to the level of detail of the data set

suitableFor.description: A description of geospatial analysis or processing that the dataset is suitable for

title.description: A name given to the resource

topicCategory.description: A high-level classification scheme to assist in the grouping and topic-based search of available spatial data resources

page.description: Page index. Page index is 0-based and cannot be a negative number.

query.description: Query string used for full text search operation

size.description: Page size. Page size must be greater than zero.

recipients.description: Map with all recipients for all messages in the response. The key is the recipient key.

value.description: Rating value. Value may be a decimal with only a single fraction digit

registered.description: True if the account is a registered consumer

countryOfResidence.description: The users country of residence. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format is expected

nationality.description: The users nationality. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format is expected

CustomerProfessionalDto.description: Current provider data. If provider is not registered, null is returned.

message.description: Exception message if development profile is enabled
